comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Robert W. (Bob) Henderson [photographer] (1914-2006) earned a BS in agronomy from Oregon State University in 1938, and served as a Farm Crops faculty member and Assistant Director of the OSU Agricultural Experiment Station from 1946 until his retirement in 1976. Henderson completed a masters degree at Cornell University and a Ph.D. in plant genetics at the University of Minnesota in 1949. Henderson was an avid photographer and carried a camera wherever he went on or off campus; he was well-known throughout Oregon for his slide presentations to schools and clubs on OSU's agricultural research.—OSU Archives

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: The Henderson collection holds a special space in my archivist heart: it was the first real on-site "records review" I did as a professional archivist! Oh, to see all the different kinds of cameras he had... Lots of links: Robert Henderson Collection Guide, from OSU Archives News & Communication Media Release Gazette Times article

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: The Gazette Times article gave me a sense (likely limited ;) of what's involved with something like this! I bet every archivist wishes they had a "Arnold Appleby" !

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content:
So true! 

We have another woman right now, a retired OSU professor, who comes in with her scanner every Wednesday to scan photos-- we can all thank her for many of the Gerald Williams images in this very account...

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Hi Linda Bella ever - We have a few references to him in our collections, but it looks like he is in southern Oregon. I did a Google search for "porter lombard Southern Oregon Research and Extension Center" and found that he is on the Foundation Board of Directors for the So. Oregon Historical Society (see # their site here). Hope this gets you started! Tiah
